page.content: their child has a place at a Grammar School, while others have places at Secondary Modern Schools. To many people the children have 'passed' or 'failed.' This is the system which dominates school and home life for children in their final year at Primary School. {An Interview with Mr. Heffernan. We spoke to mr. Heffernan about his job as caretaker. He likes working at the school and starts at 6.50 a.m. He works here 7 hours a day. The first place he checks is the boiler room: the school has oil fired heating. Mondays and Fridays are his busiest days. In between jobs he chats to Mrs. Churchill. He has to check fuses, mend doors and windows, clean cupboards and stores. He has to clean the classes and corridors and lock everything when school is over for the day.
